title: Machine Learning for Zombie Hunting: Predicting Distress from Firms' Accounts and Missing Values. (arXiv:2306.08165v1 [econ.EM])
abstract: In this contribution, we propose machine learning techniques to predict zombie firms. First, we derive the risk of failure by training and testing our algorithms on disclosed financial information and non-random missing values of 304,906 firms active in Italy from 2008 to 2017. Then, we spot the highest financial distress conditional on predictions that lies above a threshold for which a combination of false positive rate (false prediction of firm failure) and false negative rate (false prediction of active firms) is minimized. Therefore, we identify zombies as firms that persist in a state of financial distress, i.e., their forecasts fall into the risk category above the threshold for at least three consecutive years. For our purpose, we implement a gradient boosting algorithm (XGBoost) that exploits information about missing values. translated_title: 机器学习用于猎杀僵尸企业：从企业账户和丢失数据预测困境
translated_abstract: 本文提出了应用机器学习技术预测僵尸企业的方法。我们通过对意大利2008年到2017年304906家公司的公开财务信息和非随机缺失数据训练和测试算法来得出风险分析。然后，我们根据预测结果中高于某个阈值的最高经济困难，最小化误报率和漏报率的组合。我们将在至少连续三年中，落入高风险分类中的企业视作“僵尸企业”，即处于财务困境的企业。为此，我们实现了一种梯度提升算法(XGBoost)，利用了丢失数据的信息。将缺失数据包含在预测模型中是至关重要的，因为未披露账户的模式与公司破产相关。最后，我们通过展示僵尸企业在长期内表现出低利润率、低生产率和低投资水平来验证我们的方法，这表明我们的发现对经济政策具有重要意义。
tldr: 本文提出了机器学习技术来预测僵尸企业。作者使用Gradient Boosting算法(XGBoost)解析未公开的财务信息和缺失数据，并用此来衡量企业的破产风险，最终得出了僵尸企业的定义和其产生的问题。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes machine learning techniques to predict zombie firms. The authors use the Gradient Boosting algorithm (XGBoost) to analyze undisclosed financial information and missing data and measure corporate bankruptcy risk, eventually defining zombie firms and identifying their problems.
